CatDescriptText: Chester Dreishach, postal worker, 1110 Brushton Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you favor an increase in state sales tax or a graduated income tax as a means of raising revenue for a commonwealth of Pennsylvania?" answer reads: "I am not for either one. In my opinion, I think we have enough money coming in already.  With the proper adjustments, we can operate on those funds."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Chester Dreishach wearing dark hat, striped shirt, and striped shirt, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
